aggregation_type.description: Districts are large areas of the map that usually include multiple map cells.
Points Of Interest are either individual map tiles of major importance, or are smaller regions inside a single tile's cell.
There are not many of these in most cities.
These take up an entire cell, or multiple cells, and are also strategically significant.
